title: Requires the public school curriculum for children in kindergarten through grade twelve to include a minimum of two hours per week instruction in civics lessons
summary: Requires the public school curriculum for children in kindergarten through grade twelve to include a minimum of two hours per week instruction in civics lessons.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2532

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. MENG -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to requiring  the  public
         school curriculum for children in kindergarten through grade twelve to
         include a minimum of two hours per week instruction in civics lessons

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 801-a of the education law, as amended  by  chapter
    2  482 of the laws of 2010, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S 801-a. Instruction in civility, citizenship and character education.
    4  1.  The  regents  shall  ensure that the course of instruction in grades
    5  kindergarten through twelve includes a component on  civility,  citizen-
    6  ship  and character education. Such component shall instruct students on
    7  the  principles  of  honesty,  tolerance,  RACIAL  AND  GLOBAL  HARMONY,
    8  personal  responsibility, MORALS, ETHICS, respect for others, observance
    9  of laws and rules, courtesy, dignity and other traits which will enhance
   10  the quality of their experiences in, and contributions to, the  communi-
   11  ty.  THE  INSTRUCTION  SHALL EMPHASIZE THE PRACTICAL APPLICATION OF SUCH
   12  LESSONS AND THE SHORT-TERM AND LONG-TERM IMPACT ON  THE  STUDENT'S  LIFE
   13  AND ON THE LIVES OF OTHERS OF IMPLEMENTING THE LESSONS.
   14    2.  THE  BOARDS  OF  EDUCATION  AND  TRUSTEES OF THE CITIES AND SCHOOL
   15  DISTRICTS OF THE STATE SHALL REQUIRE INSTRUCTION TO  BE  GIVEN  IN  SUCH
   16  MATTERS  FOR  A  MINIMUM  PERIOD  OF TWO HOURS PER WEEK, BY THE TEACHERS
   17  EMPLOYED IN THE SCHOOLS THEREIN, COMMENCING WITH THE TWO THOUSAND  NINE-
   18  -TWO THOUSAND TEN SCHOOL YEAR. ALL PUPILS OVER THE AGE OF FIVE YEARS WHO
   19  ATTEND PUBLIC SCHOOLS SHALL RECEIVE SUCH INSTRUCTION.
   20    3.  The  regents  shall determine how to incorporate such component in
   21  existing curricula and the commissioner shall promulgate any regulations
   22  needed to carry out such determination of the regents. For the  purposes
   23  of  this  section, "tolerance," "respect for others" and "dignity" shall
   24  include awareness and sensitivity to discrimination  or  harassment  and

    1  civility  in  the  relations  of  people  of  different  races, weights,
    2  national origins, ethnic groups, religions, religious practices,  mental
    3  or physical abilities, sexual orientations, genders, and sexes.
    4    S  2.  This  act  shall  take  effect on the same date and in the same
    5  manner as section 3 of chapter 482 of the laws of 2010, takes effect.
